page.title: 17WILD LIFE
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF GLENRIDDING IS A SMALL PLACE IN THE LAKE LAND. THERE IS A LOT OF WILD LIFE INCLUDING: FOXES, RABBITS, HARES, BADGERS, DEER, MINK AND WEASEL. WE HAVE A LARGE AMOUNT OF BIRDS INCLUDING SWANS, BUZZARDS,GOLDEN EAGLES,CURLEWES,ROBINS AND CROWS.FOR WILD LIFE TO SURVIVE THERE HAS TO BE PLENTY OF FOOD. AS WELL THERE HAS TO BE TREES TO PROUNDE COVER FOR ANIMALS AND BIRDS.MOST OF THE TREES GROW CLOSE BY TO LAKE ULLSWATER .THE LAKE TOO IS WELL STOCKED WITH FISH, MANY OF WHICH ARE TROUT. MUCH OF OUR AREA IS HIGH MOUNTAIN WHICH IS POPULAR WITH WALKERS. MUCH OF THE NATURAL LAND COVER IS GRASS OR HEATHER, WITH A HIGH AMOUNT OF BRACKEN WHICH GROWS IN THE LATTER HALF OF THE YEAR. THE WEATHER IN OUR AREA IS EXTREMELY VARIABLE BECAUSE OF THE INFLUENCE OF THE MOUNTAINS.
